column2:
```r
fix_time_measures_all %>% 
  dplyr::filter(target_word_nr == word_nr) %>% 
  dplyr::group_by(language,cond) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(ffd_mean = mean(ffd, na.rm = TRUE),
            gd_mean = mean(gd, na.rm = TRUE),
            gopast_mean = mean(gopast, na.rm = TRUE),
            tvt_mean = mean(tvt, na.rm = TRUE),
            skipping_mean = mean(skipping, na.rm = TRUE))
```
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'language'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
